servinfo.title: DTC P0118: Engine Coolant Temperature Circuit High

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P0116: Engine Coolant Temperature Circuit Range / Performance:M16A and J20A .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Voltage of ECT sensor output is more than 4.8 V for 0.5 sec continuously
(Low engine coolant temperature (high voltage / high resistance))

attention3.ptxt: When DTC P0108, P0113 and P0533 are indicated together, it is possible that “GRY/GRN” wire circuit open.

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC using scan tool.
Start engine and run it for 10 sec. or more.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions for DTC Troubleshooting:M16A and J20A .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check:M16A and J20A .

testgroup.title: ECT sensor and its circuit check

test1.ptxt: Connect scan tool with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check engine coolant temp. displayed on scan tool.

testgroup.question: Is –40 °C (–40 °F) indicated?

paragroup.ptxt: Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from ECT sensor with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection to ECT sensor at “PPL/YEL” and “GRY/GRN” wire terminals.
If OK, then turn ON ignition switch, measure voltage between “PPL/YEL” wire terminal of ECT sensor connector and vehicle body ground.
Remove ECM from its bracket with ECM connectors connected.
Check for proper connection of ECM connector at “C37-24” terminal.
If OK, then turn ON ignition switch, measure voltage between “C37-24” wire terminal of ECM connector and vehicle body ground.

paragroup.ptxt: “PPL/YEL” wire is open circuit. If wire and connection are OK, go to Step 5.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure voltage between “PPL/YEL” wire terminal of ECT sensor connector and vehicle body ground.

paragroup.ptxt: “PPL/YEL” wire is shorted to other circuit.
If wire is OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Measure resistance between “C37-24” terminal of ECM connector and “PPL/YEL” wire terminal of ECT sensor connector with ignition switch turn OFF.
Check for proper connection of ECT sensor connector at “GRY/GRN” wire terminal.
Measure resistance between “GRY/GRN” wire terminal of ECT sensor connector and vehicle body ground.
Measure resistance between “C37-57” terminal of ECM connector and vehicle body ground.

paragroup.ptxt: “GRY/GRN” wire is open circuit or high resistance circuit. Poor “C37-57” connection.
Faulty ECM ground circuit. If circuit is OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Check ECT sensor according to Engine Coolant Temperature (ECT) Sensor Inspection:M16A and J20A .

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
